FuncDef:
The nat alarm server-map disable command disables the log and alarm functions for the server-map table.
The undo nat alarm server-map disable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the log and alarm functions are enabled for the server-map table.
CLIs: nat alarm server-map { log | trap } disable
undo nat alarm server-map { log | trap } disable

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the log function. This parameter indicates whether a device generates a log message after the number of server-map entries exceeds a specified log threshold. or after the number of server-map entries falls below 80% of a specified log threshold.
-

Indicates the alarm function. This parameter indicates whether a device generates an alarm message after the number of server-map entries exceeds a specified alarm threshold, or after the number of server-map entries falls below 80% of a specified alarm threshold.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The log and alarm functions are enabled by default. To disable the functions, run the nat alarm server-map disable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
